title: What happened to this game!!?
text: I loved this game and recently I’ve been getting so screwed over. All my balls stop right before going in EVERY ROUND. That never used to happen and it’s constant even tho I’m hitting it correctly. The game is so rigged it’s not even funny. I’ve lost all my coins playing. My screen keeps freezing up every hit I go to take. I got my ball in once and the turn was given to the other player which it shouldn’t have. I’m getting fed up with this. Fix the game.

title: How good 8 ball pool is
text: 8 ball pool is a very fun video game version of the real life game billiard. This game is fun and competitive all in one I like it a lot

title: Good game, too many microtransactions
text: The game is great and has a very active player base. However, I very much dislike the constant popups begging for my money. Even the free daily mini games constantly bombard you with payment options. Being offered "special" cues, etc between matches is also annoying, especially when you go bankrupt. I play this game on the toilet, I don't have time to waste declining all these offers.

title: $$$$ to stay in it.
text: Great game at first but now it’s a scam at every level, but it requires an expenditure of real cash to move up after a certain level, and it’s not cheap to stay in the game, your shots become less accurate after not spending cash to upgrade the many, many enticements offered to players. It gets frustrating after a while, but you have a multitude of cues, upgrades to cues, (I have earned over 100) and options too numerous to list for upgrading your status. The game gets ridiculous after a while and balances out only if you spend a LOT of cash.

title: Game is definitely rigged to make you spend money
text: I’ve been playing the game for a week now and at first it was fun. I won a few/ I lost a few. I made a bad gamble and lost a significant chunk of my change and that’s where it started. No matter what , I kept losing and couldn’t catch back up. I lost some games to ridiculous shots that shouldn’t have been in that level of playing. So I spent a few dollars to get some better cues and cash. Instead all I found was I ended up playing significantly higher level players and still losing!! To sum it up: the game is fun if you don’t care about progressing much but is clearly designed to make you spend cash.

title: A game to pass the time
text:
This game is good. But will punish you if you invest to much time actually trying to improve your stats with back to back games. The developers have an incentive for consumers to keep the app downloaded through its algorithm. Meaning play a few games feel happy come back tomorrow. 

I had the apps downloaded for over 30 days made over 500,000 coins within that time. I won tournaments, became a champion in bronze, brass & silver leagues. I only played a few games here and there in passing. I never meant to play for stats or to even win just to have fun. 

However when decided to chase stats as mine were improving with each game. I would face A.I bots that were levels 110-150. In back to back games. Even though I was only level 20. That never happened when I was just casually playing the game every other day. I would face real players my level & from time to time become friends with those real people. 

The game also gives an advantage to players that were good sports & kind. I tested this theory quite often in fact. If you don’t rush yourself & praise your opponent  for their effort. Then it’s quite easy to get a Hail Mary win even though you should’ve lost. Regardless this is one of the better games I’ve played. Just don’t ever pay to play or pay to win. Don’t become arrogant & attempt to win several back to back games. Eventually you’ll face an opponent the algorithm has chosen to defeat you. Purposefully of course as losing keeps winners wanting to comeback for more.
